meaning_en: Relating to education, especially at a college or university level.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับวิชาการ,ทางการศึกษา
example:
The university has a strong academic reputation.
He decided to pursue an academic career.
Academic success is not the only measure of intelligence.

meaning_en: The subjects comprising a course of study in a school or college.
meaning_th: หลักสูตร
example:
The new curriculum places a greater emphasis on science.
The school is revising its curriculum to include more practical skills.
Students are required to take a broad range of subjects in their curriculum.

meaning_en: The method and practice of teaching.
meaning_th: ศาสตร์การสอน, การสอน
example:
The workshop focused on modern pedagogy and teaching techniques.
Effective pedagogy is crucial for student engagement.
Teachers are always seeking to improve their pedagogy.

meaning_en: The ability to read and write.
meaning_th: การรู้หนังสือ
example:
The program aims to improve adult literacy in rural areas.
Digital literacy is a vital skill in the modern world.
The government has launched a campaign to promote financial literacy.

meaning_en: Relating to an occupation or employment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับอาชีพ, ทางอาชีวะ
example:
Vocational training provides practical skills for a specific job.
He chose a vocational college over a traditional university.
The new school offers a variety of vocational courses.

meaning_en: To make something greater by adding to it.
meaning_th: เพิ่มพูน, ขยาย
example:
The teacher uses technology to augment classroom learning.
He took a part-time job to augment his income.
These exercises are designed to augment your vocabulary.

meaning_en: A great difference.
meaning_th: ความเหลื่อมล้ำ, ความแตกต่าง
example:
There is a clear disparity in educational opportunities between urban and rural areas.
The report highlights the wage disparity between men and women.
They are working to address the global health disparity.

meaning_en: Characterized by the belief that the parts of something are interconnected and can be explained only by reference to the whole.
meaning_th: แบบองค์รวม
example:
A holistic approach to education focuses on the student's entire development, not just academic achievement.
We need to take a more holistic view of the problem.
The program promotes a holistic view of wellness, including mind, body, and spirit.

meaning_en: A qualification, achievement, or aspect of a person's background.
meaning_th: ใบรับรอง, คุณสมบัติ
example:
A university degree is a valuable credential for many jobs.
The company is looking for candidates with strong professional credentials.
He has impeccable credentials for the position.

meaning_en: Learning a topic through repetition and memorization, without understanding.
meaning_th: การเรียนแบบท่องจำ
example:
Rote learning is not effective for developing critical thinking.
He had to use rote learning to memorize the historical dates.
Modern education systems are moving away from rote learning.

meaning_en: Activities that complement the formal curriculum.
meaning_th: กิจกรรมเสริมหลักสูตร
example:
Participating in co-curricular activities is essential for a well-rounded education.
The school offers various co-curricular programs like sports and music.
Employers often look for candidates with strong co-curricular involvement.

meaning_en: Protection of or authority over someone or something; guardianship.
meaning_th: การสอน, การดูแล, การปกครอง
example:
She progressed quickly under the tutelage of her piano teacher.
The young artist benefited from the tutelage of a renowned painter.
Students receive expert tutelage from experienced instructors.

meaning_en: Required by law or a rule; obligatory.
meaning_th: ภาคบังคับ, ที่ต้องทำ
example:
Education is compulsory for children between the ages of 5 and 16.
It is compulsory to wear a seatbelt in the car.
Many countries have compulsory military service.

meaning_en: Relating to the mental processes of perception, memory, and judgment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับความรู้ความเข้าใจ
example:
The test measures cognitive skills such as problem-solving.
Reading books can improve your cognitive function.
Children's cognitive development is a key focus of early education.

meaning_en: Inborn; natural.
meaning_th: ที่มีมาแต่กำเนิด, โดยธรรมชาติ
example:
She has an innate talent for music.
Some scientists believe that language ability is innate.
He has an innate sense of humor.

meaning_en: A thing that motivates or encourages one to do something.
meaning_th: สิ่งจูงใจ, แรงกระตุ้น
example:
The scholarship serves as an incentive for students to study hard.
The company offers a financial incentive for employees to improve their performance.
What is your incentive for taking this course?

meaning_en: To spread or disperse (information, ideas, etc.) widely.
meaning_th: เผยแพร่, กระจาย
example:
The school wants to disseminate information about the new program.
It is the media's role to disseminate news to the public.
We need to disseminate these findings to a wider audience.

meaning_en: To support (an organization or activity) financially.
meaning_th: อุดหนุน, สนับสนุนทางการเงิน
example:
The government subsidizes public universities to keep tuition fees low.
The state heavily subsidizes the public transport system.
The company will subsidize the cost of training for its staff.

meaning_en: Fair and impartial.
meaning_th: ที่เป็นธรรม, เสมอภาค
example:
The goal is to create a more equitable education system.
They are working to ensure an equitable distribution of resources.
Everyone deserves equitable access to healthcare.

meaning_en: Extremely useful; indispensable.
meaning_th: มีค่ามาก, ประเมินค่าไม่ได้
example:
His guidance was an invaluable asset to my project.
The teachers' support has been an invaluable resource.
These research findings are invaluable for the medical community.

meaning_en: The action or process of officially recognizing someone as having a particular status or being qualified to perform a particular activity.
meaning_th: การรับรองวิทยฐานะ
example:
The program's accreditation ensures a high standard of education.
The hospital is seeking accreditation from a national board.
This degree has an international accreditation.

meaning_en: The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
meaning_th: การประเมินผล
example:
The teacher uses a variety of assessment methods to evaluate student progress.
The final assessment will be a written exam.
Regular assessments help identify areas for improvement.

meaning_en: The ability to understand something.
meaning_th: ความเข้าใจ
example:
Reading comprehension is a key skill for students.
He has a good comprehension of the subject matter.
The test measures your listening comprehension.

meaning_en: Relating to a curriculum.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับหลักสูตร
example:
The curricular framework provides a guide for teachers.
We need to focus on curricular reform.
The school's curricular offerings are very diverse.

meaning_en: The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior.
meaning_th: ระเบียบวินัย, สาขาวิชา
example:
Good discipline is essential for a productive learning environment.
She is studying a new discipline called computational biology.
The teacher maintains strict discipline in the classroom.

meaning_en: To give someone the authority or power to do something.
meaning_th: ให้อำนาจ, ทำให้มีอำนาจ
example:
Education can empower individuals to make better life choices.
The program is designed to empower women in the workplace.
He felt empowered after the workshop.

meaning_en: The action of enrolling or being enrolled.
meaning_th: การลงทะเบียนเรียน
example:
Student enrollment has increased significantly this year.
The university has a high enrollment rate.
They are holding an open house to boost new enrollment.

meaning_en: A group of university departments concerned with a major division of knowledge.
meaning_th: คณะ, คณาจารย์
example:
She is a member of the university's arts faculty.
The faculty meeting will be held on Friday.
The faculty is highly respected in its field.

meaning_en: The quality of bending easily without breaking.
meaning_th: ความยืดหยุ่น
example:
The new schedule offers more flexibility for students.
Flexibility is a key characteristic of modern education.
He has a high degree of flexibility in his work hours.

meaning_en: A sum of money given by an organization for a particular purpose.
meaning_th: เงินช่วยเหลือ, เงินทุน
example:
She received a grant to fund her research.
The student applied for a government grant to cover tuition fees.
The university awarded a grant for the new project.

meaning_en: Advice or information aimed at resolving a problem or difficulty.
meaning_th: คำแนะนำ, การชี้แนะ
example:
Students receive guidance from their academic advisors.
She provides guidance to her younger siblings.
The career counselor offers guidance on job choices.

meaning_en: The action or process of innovating.
meaning_th: นวัตกรรม, การสร้างสรรค์
example:
Technological innovation is changing the way we learn.
The company is known for its innovation in product design.
He is a leader in educational innovation.

meaning_en: An organization founded for a religious, educational, social, or similar purpose.
meaning_th: สถาบัน
example:
Harvard University is a prestigious academic institution.
They established a new research institution.
The institution has a long and respected history.

meaning_en: The position of a student or trainee who works in an organization, sometimes without pay, in order to gain work experience.
meaning_th: การฝึกงาน
example:
He did a summer internship at a law firm.
An internship provides valuable real-world experience.
The company offers paid internships to students.

meaning_en: The guidance provided by a mentor, especially an experienced person.
meaning_th: การให้คำปรึกษา, การให้คำแนะนำ
example:
The program provides one-on-one mentorship for new teachers.
Good mentorship is crucial for professional development.
He benefited from his mentor's guidance and mentorship.

meaning_en: A high degree of competence or skill; expertise.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญ, ความชำนาญ
example:
The course is designed to improve language proficiency.
She demonstrated great proficiency in her work.
The exam measures your proficiency in English.

meaning_en: A set of reasons or a logical basis for a course of action or a particular belief.
meaning_th: เหตุผล
example:
The rationale behind the new grading system is to reduce stress.
He explained the rationale for his decision.
What is the rationale for this policy change?

meaning_en: A grant or payment made to support a student's education.
meaning_th: ทุนการศึกษา
example:
She won a full scholarship to a top university.
He applied for a scholarship to study abroad.
The foundation offers scholarships to deserving students.

meaning_en: A conference or meeting for discussion or training.
meaning_th: การสัมมนา
example:
He attended a seminar on educational technology.
The students are required to attend a weekly seminar.
The professor led a seminar on modern literature.

meaning_en: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
meaning_th: คำอธิบายรายวิชา
example:
The syllabus for this course is available online.
The professor handed out the course syllabus on the first day.
The syllabus outlines the topics, readings, and assignments.

meaning_en: Officially recognized or authorized.
meaning_th: ที่ได้รับการรับรอง
example:
The program is accredited by the national board of education.
He is an accredited professional in his field.
The university is an accredited institution.

meaning_en: Able to adjust to new conditions.
meaning_th: ที่สามารถปรับตัวได้
example:
An adaptable curriculum can meet the needs of diverse learners.
He is a very adaptable person.
The software is adaptable to different operating systems.

meaning_en: A former student of a school, college, or university.
meaning_th: ศิษย์เก่า
example:
The university's alumni network is very strong.
He is a proud alumnus of this college.
The event is a reunion for all alumni.

meaning_en: The position of an apprentice; a period of time working for an employer to learn a trade.
meaning_th: การฝึกหัดงาน
example:
He started an apprenticeship to become an electrician.
The program offers a new apprenticeship opportunity.
Apprenticeship is a great way to learn practical skills.

meaning_en: The formation of clear and distinct sounds in speech.
meaning_th: การออกเสียง, การเชื่อมโยง
example:
Good articulation is important for public speaking.
The program aims to improve students' articulation skills.
There is a strong articulation agreement between the two colleges.

meaning_en: A teaching method that combines online educational materials and opportunities for interaction with traditional classroom methods.
meaning_th: การเรียนรู้แบบผสมผสาน
example:
Blended learning gives students more flexibility.
The school is implementing a blended learning approach.
Blended learning combines online resources with face-to-face instruction.

meaning_en: Produced by or involving two or more parties working together.
meaning_th: ร่วมมือ, ทำงานร่วมกัน
example:
Collaborative projects help students develop teamwork skills.
The project was a collaborative effort between the two departments.
We are looking for a collaborative solution.

meaning_en: Having knowledge or being aware of something.
meaning_th: ตระหนัก, รู้ตัว
example:
He was cognizant of the challenges he would face.
Students should be cognizant of the deadlines.
The committee is cognizant of the issue.

meaning_en: A teaching approach that tailors instruction to meet individual student needs.
meaning_th: การสอนที่ปรับตามความแตกต่างของผู้เรียน
example:
Differentiated instruction helps teachers address diverse learning styles.
The teacher used differentiated instruction to challenge high-achievers.
This strategy is a key part of modern pedagogy.

meaning_en: Deriving ideas, style, or taste from a broad and diverse range of sources.
meaning_th: ผสมผสาน, หลากหลาย
example:
His teaching style is eclectic, drawing from many different philosophies.
The library has an eclectic collection of books.
Her taste in music is quite eclectic.

meaning_en: The ability to produce a desired or intended result.
meaning_th: ประสิทธิภาพ
example:
The efficacy of the new teaching method is still being researched.
The study tested the efficacy of the drug.
She has great self-efficacy in her abilities.

meaning_en: To make something clear; explain.
meaning_th: อธิบายให้ชัดเจน
example:
The professor tried to elucidate the complex theory.
Can you elucidate your point further?
He used examples to elucidate the concept.

meaning_en: The ability to understand and share the feelings of another.
meaning_th: ความเห็นอกเห็นใจ
example:
Teachers need to have empathy for their students.
Empathy is a key trait of a good leader.
She has a strong sense of empathy for others.

meaning_en: The action of improving or enhancing the quality or value of something.
meaning_th: การเสริมสร้าง, การเพิ่มพูน
example:
The school offers enrichment programs for gifted students.
Reading can provide a great intellectual enrichment.
The field trip was a great form of enrichment for the class.

meaning_en: The making of a judgment about the amount, number, or value of something; assessment.
meaning_th: การประเมินค่า
example:
Student evaluations of the course are very important.
The committee performed an evaluation of the project.
A fair evaluation should be objective.

meaning_en: (of an activity at a school or college) taken in addition to the normal curriculum.
meaning_th: นอกหลักสูตร
example:
Joining extracurricular activities can enhance your college application.
He is very involved in extracurricular clubs.
The school offers a wide range of extracurricular sports.

meaning_en: A person who helps a group to work together more effectively.
meaning_th: ผู้อำนวยความสะดวก
example:
The teacher acts as a facilitator, guiding students in their own learning.
She was an excellent facilitator for the workshop.
A good facilitator makes sure everyone's voice is heard.

meaning_en: Assessment that monitors student learning to provide ongoing feedback that can be used by instructors to improve their teaching and by students to improve their learning.
meaning_th: การประเมินเพื่อปรับปรุงการเรียนรู้
example:
Teachers use formative assessment to adjust their lessons.
Quizzes can be used as a form of formative assessment.
Formative assessment is a key part of student-centered learning.

meaning_en: A general rule, principle, or piece of advice.
meaning_th: แนวทาง
example:
The school has strict guidelines for student behavior.
Follow the guidelines to complete the project correctly.
These are just guidelines, not strict rules.

meaning_en: Of mixed character; composed of different elements.
meaning_th: ผสม
example:
The university offers a hybrid degree program that combines online and in-person classes.
This car has a hybrid engine.
The new approach is a hybrid of traditional and modern methods.

meaning_en: Providing or involving deep absorption or immersion in something.
meaning_th: ที่ดื่มด่ำ, ที่ทำให้เหมือนจริง
example:
The virtual reality tour provides an immersive learning experience.
He had an immersive experience in the local culture.
The new game creates an immersive world for players.

meaning_en: A teaching method that emphasizes the student's role in the learning process by asking questions, investigating ideas, and constructing new knowledge.
meaning_th: การเรียนรู้จากการสืบเสาะ
example:
Inquiry-based learning encourages critical thinking and problem-solving.
The science class uses an inquiry-based learning approach.
This method puts students in charge of their own learning.

meaning_en: To combine (one thing) with another so that they become a whole.
meaning_th: บูรณาการ, รวมเข้าด้วยกัน
example:
The curriculum aims to integrate art and science.
The company is trying to integrate the new system with the old one.
You need to integrate your new ideas with the existing framework.

meaning_en: Relating to more than one branch of knowledge.
meaning_th: สหวิทยาการ
example:
The course is an interdisciplinary study of art and history.
We need an interdisciplinary approach to solve this problem.
Her research is highly interdisciplinary.

meaning_en: Repeating a process in a way that improves on previous results.
meaning_th: ซ้ำไปซ้ำมาเพื่อปรับปรุง
example:
The project used an iterative design process.
Learning is an iterative process of trial and error.
We will be making iterative changes to the software.

meaning_en: A statement of what a learner is expected to know, understand, and/or be able to demonstrate after completing a process of learning.
meaning_th: ผลลัพธ์การเรียนรู้
example:
The learning outcomes for this course are clearly defined.
We need to measure the learning outcomes of the program.
Every lesson has a specific learning outcome.

meaning_en: Awareness and understanding of one's own thought processes.
meaning_th: อภิปัญญา, การรู้คิดของตนเอง
example:
Metacognition is a key skill for effective learning.
The professor encouraged metacognition by asking students to reflect on their learning process.
This concept involves thinking about your thinking.

meaning_en: Evaluation of a person's work or performance by a group of people in the same occupation, profession, or industry.
meaning_th: การทบทวนโดยเพื่อน
example:
The students presented their projects for peer review.
Peer review is a crucial part of academic publishing.
The system allows for anonymous peer review.

meaning_en: A range of work or materials that represents a person's capabilities and achievements.
meaning_th: แฟ้มสะสมผลงาน
example:
The art student created a portfolio of her best work.
He submitted his portfolio for the job application.
A digital portfolio can showcase your skills.

meaning_en: A high degree of competence or skill; expertise.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญ, ความชำนาญ
example:
The course is designed to improve language proficiency.
She demonstrated great proficiency in her work.
The exam measures your proficiency in English.

meaning_en: A method of inquiry and debate based on asking and answering questions.
meaning_th: วิธีการสอนแบบโสคราติส
example:
The teacher used the Socratic method to encourage critical thinking.
The Socratic method is often used in law schools.
This method involves dialogue between teacher and students.

meaning_en: Any examination that is administered and scored in a predetermined, standard manner.
meaning_th: การทดสอบมาตรฐาน
example:
Standardized tests are used to compare student performance across the country.
Many universities require a standardized test score for admission.
There is a lot of debate about the use of standardized tests.

meaning_en: Assessment of participants' learning at the end of an instructional unit.
meaning_th: การประเมินเพื่อสรุปผลการเรียนรู้
example:
The final exam is a form of summative assessment.
The project at the end of the semester is a summative assessment.
Summative assessment evaluates what a student has learned.

meaning_en: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
meaning_th: คำอธิบายรายวิชา
example:
The syllabus for this course is available online.
The professor handed out the course syllabus on the first day.
The syllabus outlines the topics, readings, and assignments.

meaning_en: A period of instruction given by a tutor to one or more students.
meaning_th: การเรียนการสอนพิเศษ
example:
Students meet with their tutor for a weekly tutorial.
The online platform provides interactive video tutorials.
The tutorial helps students understand complex topics.

meaning_en: Relating to or in the form of words.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับคำพูด
example:
He has excellent verbal communication skills.
The verbal instructions were difficult to follow.
The test measures your verbal reasoning ability.

meaning_en: A learning environment that uses technology and is not in a traditional classroom.
meaning_th: การเรียนรู้เสมือนจริง
example:
Virtual learning has become very popular since the pandemic.
The school offers a virtual learning program for students who can't attend in person.
Students access course materials through a virtual learning platform.

meaning_en: A seminar or other presentation that takes place on the Internet.
meaning_th: การสัมมนาผ่านเว็บ
example:
The university is hosting a webinar on applying for scholarships.
You can register for the free webinar online.
The company's marketing team will present a webinar.

meaning_en: An act of assessing something or someone.
meaning_th: การประเมิน
example:
Teacher appraisals are conducted annually to ensure quality.
The formal appraisal of the project will take place next month.
He received a positive performance appraisal.

meaning_en: An asset or object bought or obtained.
meaning_th: การได้มา, การรับเอา
example:
Language acquisition is a complex process.
The company's acquisition of the smaller firm was a success.
He is studying the acquisition of knowledge in children.

meaning_en: The state of having inconsistent thoughts, beliefs, or attitudes.
meaning_th: ความไม่สอดคล้องทางความคิด
example:
The student experienced cognitive dissonance when his beliefs were challenged.
The theory of cognitive dissonance explains why people avoid information that contradicts their views.
He felt a lot of cognitive dissonance when he learned the truth.

meaning_en: The process of ensuring a person is qualified to perform a task or has achieved a certain level of training.
meaning_th: การออกใบรับรอง
example:
Professional credentialing is important for career advancement.
The board is responsible for the credentialing of all new members.
The credentialing process can be very time-consuming.

meaning_en: A brief account of a person's education, qualifications, and previous occupations.
meaning_th: ประวัติการทำงานโดยละเอียด
example:
He submitted his curriculum vitae along with his application.
A curriculum vitae is more detailed than a resume.
Your curriculum vitae should highlight your academic achievements.

meaning_en: A division or contrast between two things that are or are represented as being opposed or entirely different.
meaning_th: การแบ่งเป็นสองส่วน
example:
The dichotomy between theory and practice is often discussed in education.
There is a clear dichotomy in his thinking.
The film explores the dichotomy of good and evil.

meaning_en: Intended to teach, particularly in having moral instruction as an ulterior motive.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการสอน, ที่ให้คำสั่งสอน
example:
The professor's didactic style was very effective for teaching complex subjects.
The book is a didactic novel.
His didactic approach often came across as condescending.

meaning_en: Based on, concerned with, or verifiable by observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic.
meaning_th: เชิงประจักษ์, จากการทดลอง
example:
The study's findings are based on empirical evidence.
He relied on empirical data to support his argument.
The research used an empirical approach.

meaning_en: The theory of knowledge, especially with regard to its methods, validity, and scope.
meaning_th: ญาณวิทยา
example:
Epistemology is a core part of philosophy and education.
He is studying the epistemology of science.
The course covered the fundamentals of epistemology.

meaning_en: To make an action or process easy or easier.
meaning_th: อำนวยความสะดวก
example:
The teacher's role is to facilitate learning, not just lecture.
The new software will facilitate communication among team members.
Technology can facilitate access to information.

meaning_en: Of the same kind; alike.
meaning_th: ที่เหมือนกัน
example:
The class was quite homogeneous in terms of ability.
The team is a homogeneous group of experts.
They mixed the ingredients to create a homogeneous mixture.

meaning_en: A system of ideas and ideals, especially one that forms the basis of economic or political theory and policy.
meaning_th: อุดมการณ์
example:
Educational ideology often influences policy and practice.
He lives by a strong personal ideology.
The political ideology of the party is clear.

meaning_en: The practice or policy of providing equal access to opportunities and resources for people who might otherwise be excluded.
meaning_th: การรวมเข้าด้วยกัน, การไม่แบ่งแยก
example:
The school is committed to the inclusion of all students, regardless of ability.
Inclusion is a core principle of modern education.
They are working towards social and economic inclusion.

meaning_en: A type of logical thinking that involves forming generalizations based on specific instances.
meaning_th: การให้เหตุผลแบบอุปนัย
example:
Inductive reasoning is a key part of scientific discovery.
The teacher used inductive reasoning to guide students to a conclusion.
He used several examples to demonstrate inductive reasoning.

meaning_en: The drive to do something for internal reasons, such as personal satisfaction or a sense of purpose.
meaning_th: แรงจูงใจภายใน
example:
Intrinsic motivation is more powerful than external rewards.
He has an intrinsic motivation to help others.
The project relies on students' intrinsic motivation.

meaning_en: The fact of two things being seen or placed close together with contrasting effect.
meaning_th: การวางเคียงกัน
example:
The juxtaposition of traditional and modern teaching methods was interesting.
The play's humor comes from the juxtaposition of serious and silly scenes.
She noted the juxtaposition of poverty and wealth in the city.

meaning_en: A learning style that involves physical activity, rather than lectures or observing others.
meaning_th: การเรียนรู้จากการเคลื่อนไหว
example:
Kinesthetic learning is great for students who learn best by doing.
The school uses kinesthetic learning to teach science concepts.
The hands-on activity promoted kinesthetic learning.

meaning_en: A policy or attitude of letting things take their own course, without interfering.
meaning_th: ปล่อยให้เป็นไปตามยถากรรม
example:
The professor's laissez-faire teaching style allowed students great freedom.
The government has adopted a laissez-faire approach to the economy.
He has a laissez-faire attitude towards his children's education.

meaning_en: The scientific study of language and its structure.
meaning_th: ภาษาศาสตร์
example:
He is a professor of linguistics.
The course covers phonetics, syntax, and other aspects of linguistics.
She has a degree in applied linguistics.

meaning_en: A device such as a pattern of letters, ideas, or associations that assists in remembering something.
meaning_th: ความทรงจำช่วย
example:
He used a mnemonic to remember the names of the planets.
A simple mnemonic device can make a big difference in studying.
The phrase ROY G. BIV" is a mnemonic for the colors of the rainbow."

meaning_en: A typical example or pattern of something; a model.
meaning_th: กระบวนทัศน์
example:
The new theory is a paradigm shift in education.
The internet has created a new paradigm for communication.
His work offers a new paradigm for understanding the issue.

meaning_en: Relating to teaching.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับวิธีสอน
example:
His pedagogical approach is very innovative.
The teacher's pedagogical skills are excellent.
The conference focused on pedagogical theories.

meaning_en: A high degree of competence or skill.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญ
example:
The course is designed to improve language proficiency.
She demonstrated great proficiency in her work.
The exam measures your proficiency in English.

meaning_en: Required for a particular purpose or position.
meaning_th: ที่จำเป็น
example:
A university degree is a requisite for this job.
He has all the requisite skills for the position.
Patience is a requisite for being a good teacher.

meaning_en: The provision of temporary support to help a student learn a new skill.
meaning_th: การช่วยเหลือแบบชั่วคราว
example:
Teachers use scaffolding to help students with difficult tasks.
The tutor provided scaffolding by breaking down the problem into smaller steps.
This method involves providing support that is gradually removed.

meaning_en: A representation of a plan or theory in the form of an outline or model.
meaning_th: แผนการ, โครงสร้าง
example:
Students build new knowledge by connecting it to their existing schemas.
The architect created a schema for the building.
The brain organizes information into cognitive schemas.

meaning_en: The process of making something conform to a standard.
meaning_th: การทำให้เป็นมาตรฐาน
example:
The standardization of curriculum helps ensure quality across schools.
The company is working on the standardization of its products.
Standardization can sometimes stifle creativity.

meaning_en: Relating to or constituting a summary; concluded by a final act.
meaning_th: ที่สรุปผล
example:
A final exam is a summative assessment of a student's knowledge.
The project report provided a summative overview of the research.
This is a summative review of the whole year's work.

meaning_en: Existing or occurring at the same time.
meaning_th: พร้อมกัน, ที่เกิดขึ้นในเวลาเดียวกัน
example:
Synchronous online classes require students and teachers to be online at the same time.
The team had a synchronous meeting every morning.
The dance was performed in synchronous movements.

meaning_en: The arrangement of words and phrases to create well-formed sentences in a language.
meaning_th: วากยสัมพันธ์
example:
The student's essay had many errors in syntax.
He is studying the syntax of English.
Proper syntax is crucial for clear writing.

meaning_en: The branch of science concerned with classification.
meaning_th: อนุกรมวิธาน, การจัดหมวดหมู่
example:
Bloom's Taxonomy is a widely used framework for educational objectives.
The project involves the taxonomy of plants.
He has created a new taxonomy for his data.

meaning_en: A statement or theory that is put forward as a premise to be maintained or proved.
meaning_th: วิทยานิพนธ์, ข้อสรุป
example:
She is writing her master's thesis on a new teaching method.
His main thesis is that education should be free.
He defended his thesis in front of a panel of experts.

meaning_en: Relating to or involving more than one academic discipline.
meaning_th: ข้ามสาขาวิชา
example:
The project took a transdisciplinary approach, blending science, art, and philosophy.
Transdisciplinary research aims to solve problems that are beyond the scope of a single field.
It's a step beyond interdisciplinary.

meaning_en: A student at a college or university who has not yet received a degree.
meaning_th: นักศึกษาระดับปริญญาตรี
example:
She is an undergraduate student at Cambridge.
The university offers many undergraduate courses.
He is in his final year as an undergraduate.

meaning_en: The process of establishing the truth, accuracy, or validity of something.
meaning_th: การตรวจสอบความถูกต้อง
example:
The lab is responsible for the verification of the test results.
He provided the necessary documents for verification.
The process requires careful verification of all data points.

meaning_en: Relating to the perception of bodily position and movement, including the sense of balance.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการทรงตัว
example:
A strong vestibular system is important for a child's learning.
The vestibular system is located in the inner ear.
Vestibular input is part of some special education programs.

meaning_en: The tendency to give instruction or to moralize.
meaning_th: ลัทธิการสอน
example:
The novel was criticized for its excessive didacticism.
His speeches are full of didacticism.
The film avoids overt didacticism in favor of subtlety.

meaning_en: Divided into two parts.
meaning_th: แบ่งเป็นสองส่วน
example:
The education system is often seen as dichotomous, separating students into academic and vocational tracks.
The test has dichotomous questions.
The research reveals a dichotomous result.

meaning_en: Authority or power given to someone to do something.
meaning_th: การให้อำนาจ
example:
The school aims to foster student empowerment through leadership programs.
The movement advocates for the empowerment of women.
This policy leads to local empowerment.

meaning_en: To improve or enhance the quality or value of something.
meaning_th: เสริมสร้าง
example:
Reading can enrich your vocabulary.
The program is designed to enrich the lives of young children.
Travel can enrich your understanding of different cultures.

meaning_en: The process of learning through experience, and is more specifically defined as 'learning through reflection on doing'.
meaning_th: การเรียนรู้จากประสบการณ์
example:
The program focuses on experiential learning, with students working on real projects.
Experiential learning is a powerful teaching method.
The school trip was a form of experiential learning.

meaning_en: Outside the walls or boundaries of a city, university, etc.
meaning_th: นอกมหาวิทยาลัย
example:
The university offers extramural courses for non-students.
He is an extramural student.
The team played an extramural match.

meaning_en: Serving to form something, especially having a profound influence on a person's development.
meaning_th: ที่มีส่วนในการก่อร่างสร้างตัว
example:
The formative years of a child's education are crucial.
This was a formative experience in my career.
The professor's feedback was formative for my project.

meaning_en: In a holistic manner.
meaning_th: แบบองค์รวม
example:
The school approaches each student holistically.
We need to think holistically about the problem.
The program addresses wellness holistically.

meaning_en: To motivate or encourage someone to do something.
meaning_th: จูงใจ, กระตุ้น
example:
The school will incentivize good attendance with rewards.
The company is trying to incentivize employees to work harder.
What will incentivize people to use this new system?

meaning_en: An act of asking for information.
meaning_th: การสืบสวนสอบสวน, การสอบถาม
example:
The students engaged in a deep inquiry into the subject.
She made an inquiry about the course.
The report is the result of a lengthy inquiry.

meaning_en: Relating to the intellect.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับสติปัญญา
example:
The course provides great intellectual stimulation.
He is a highly intellectual person.
The debate was on an intellectual level.

meaning_en: Relating to relationships or communication between people.
meaning_th: ระหว่างบุคคล
example:
The program focuses on developing students' interpersonal skills.
He has excellent interpersonal skills.
Her interpersonal relationships at work are very positive.

meaning_en: Relating to a person's awareness of the position and movement of the parts of the body.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับการเคลื่อนไหว
example:
Kinesthetic learning is great for hands-on activities.
The exercise improves kinesthetic awareness.
The dance class engages kinesthetic intelligence.

meaning_en: Able to read and write.
meaning_th: ที่อ่านออกเขียนได้
example:
He is a very literate person.
The population is now 99% literate.
Being digitally literate is essential in today's world.

meaning_en: The detailed coordination of a complex operation involving many people, facilities, or supplies.
meaning_th: การจัดการ, การขนส่ง
example:
The logistics of organizing the school trip were complex.
He is in charge of the event logistics.
The team handled the logistics for the conference.

meaning_en: The action of enrolling at a college or university.
meaning_th: การลงทะเบียนเรียน
example:
Matriculation at the university takes place in September.
He completed his matriculation papers.
The ceremony marks the beginning of their matriculation.

meaning_en: A system of methods used in a particular area of study or activity.
meaning_th: ระเบียบวิธี
example:
The research methodology for the study was very rigorous.
The professor explained his teaching methodology.
The book describes a new methodology for language acquisition.

meaning_en: A particular mode in which something exists or is experienced or expressed.
meaning_th: รูปแบบ, ลักษณะ
example:
The class is offered in three modalities: online, in-person, and hybrid.
We need to consider the various modalities of learning.
The new system has multiple modalities for user input.

meaning_en: Each of a set of self-contained units that can be used in combination with other units.
meaning_th: โมดูล, ส่วนประกอบ
example:
The course is divided into four modules.
You need to complete all the modules to get the certificate.
The online training consists of several learning modules.

meaning_en: A detailed written study of a single specialized subject or an aspect of it.
meaning_th: เอกสารวิจัย, บทความเฉพาะเรื่อง
example:
He published a monograph on the history of education.
The library holds a rare monograph on the topic.
The research was presented in a detailed monograph.

meaning_en: The use of more than one language.
meaning_th: ความสามารถหลายภาษา
example:
The school promotes multilingualism and cultural understanding.
Her multilingualism is an asset in her job.
Multilingualism is common in many parts of the world.

meaning_en: A teacher, especially a strict or pedantic one.
meaning_th: นักการศึกษา, ครู
example:
He is a respected pedagogue and a great writer.
The old pedagogue was known for his rigorous methods.
The conference brought together many renowned pedagogues.

meaning_en: The practice of taking someone else's work or ideas and passing them off as one's own.
meaning_th: การคัดลอกผลงาน, การลอกเลียนแบบ
example:
Plagiarism is a serious academic offense.
The university has a strict policy against plagiarism.
He was accused of plagiarism in his essay.

meaning_en: A thing that is required as a prior condition for something else to happen or exist.
meaning_th: สิ่งจำเป็นเบื้องต้น
example:
A good understanding of math is a prerequisite for this course.
Passing the first exam is a prerequisite for the next level.
What are the prerequisites for the program?

meaning_en: Relating to, measuring, or measured by the quality of something rather than its quantity.
meaning_th: เชิงคุณภาพ
example:
The study used a qualitative approach to analyze student feedback.
We need to do a qualitative assessment of the program.
The research is based on qualitative data.

meaning_en: Relating to, measuring, or measured by the quantity of something rather than its quality.
meaning_th: เชิงปริมาณ
example:
The report is based on quantitative data.
We need a quantitative analysis of the results.
The research used a quantitative approach.

meaning_en: Thoroughness and accuracy.
meaning_th: ความเข้มงวด, ความละเอียดถี่ถ้วน
example:
The program is known for its academic rigor.
He applied a high degree of rigor to his research.
The exam was designed with a great deal of rigor.

meaning_en: A set of rules or instructions, especially one for a test or task.
meaning_th: เกณฑ์การให้คะแนน
example:
The teacher provided a detailed rubric for the essay.
You can use the rubric to understand how your project will be graded.
The rubric clearly outlines the expectations.

meaning_en: The action or state of setting someone or something apart from other people or things or being set apart.
meaning_th: การแบ่งแยก
example:
Racial segregation in schools was a major issue in the past.
Segregation of students with different abilities can be harmful.
We need to end segregation in all forms.

meaning_en: The process of becoming an expert in a particular subject or skill.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญเฉพาะด้าน
example:
She chose a specialization in artificial intelligence.
The program offers a wide range of specializations.
His specialization is in ancient history.

meaning_en: The state of not flowing or moving; a lack of activity, growth, or development.
meaning_th: ความซบเซา, การหยุดนิ่ง
example:
Educational stagnation is a problem in many developing countries.
The economy is experiencing a period of stagnation.
We need to overcome this intellectual stagnation.

meaning_en: A fixed regular sum paid as a salary or allowance.
meaning_th: เบี้ยเลี้ยง, เงินเดือน
example:
The company offers a stipend to interns.
He received a stipend for his graduate studies.
The fellowship provides a monthly stipend to its members.

meaning_en: The arrangement or classification of something into different groups.
meaning_th: การแบ่งชั้น
example:
Social stratification can lead to educational inequality.
The report discusses the stratification of the population by income.
The study analyzed the social stratification in the school system.

meaning_en: Based on or influenced by personal feelings, tastes, or opinions.
meaning_th: อัตวิสัย
example:
The grading for the art project is often subjective.
His opinion on the matter is very subjective.
The report is too subjective and lacks objective data.

meaning_en: Able to be maintained at a certain rate or level.
meaning_th: ที่ยั่งยืน
example:
The new policy aims to create a sustainable education system.
We need to find a sustainable solution to the problem.
The project is not financially sustainable in the long run.

meaning_en: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
meaning_th: คำอธิบายรายวิชา
example:
The syllabus for this course is available online.
The professor handed out the course syllabus on the first day.
The syllabus outlines the topics, readings, and assignments.

meaning_en: Relating to an occupation or employment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับอาชีพ, ทางอาชีวะ
example:
Vocational training provides practical skills for a specific job.
He chose a vocational college over a traditional university.
The new school offers a variety of vocational courses.

meaning_en: In a manner that is intended to teach.
meaning_th: อย่างเป็นเชิงสอน
example:
He presented the information didactically.
The book is written didactically to help the reader learn.
The teacher speaks didactically to her students.

meaning_en: Lack of agreement or harmony between people or things.
meaning_th: ความไม่สอดคล้อง
example:
The cognitive dissonance he felt was unsettling.
There was a dissonance between what she said and what she did.
The political dissonance in the country is growing.

meaning_en: The theory that all knowledge is derived from sense-experience.
meaning_th: ประสบการณ์นิยม
example:
His philosophy is based on empiricism.
Empiricism is the foundation of modern science.
The study of human behavior is rooted in empiricism.

meaning_en: The quality of being fair and impartial.
meaning_th: ความยุติธรรม, ความเสมอภาค
example:
The policy was designed to ensure equitability in resource allocation.
The group's decision-making process is known for its equitability.
They are seeking equitability in education.

meaning_en: Activities that are not part of the normal curriculum.
meaning_th: กิจกรรมนอกหลักสูตร
example:
She participates in many extracurriculars like sports and drama.
Getting involved in extracurriculars can make you a more well-rounded person.
The school offers a variety of extracurriculars.

meaning_en: Serving to form something, especially having a profound influence on a person's development.
meaning_th: ที่ก่อให้เกิดการพัฒนา
example:
The formative years of a child's education are crucial.
This was a formative experience in my career.
The professor's feedback was formative for my project.

meaning_en: A person who provides students with advice about their academic or personal lives.
meaning_th: ครูแนะแนว
example:
The guidance counselor helped me choose my university.
Students can meet with the guidance counselor to discuss their career plans.
She is a very helpful guidance counselor.

meaning_en: The quality or state of being all the same or all of the same kind.
meaning_th: ความเป็นเนื้อเดียวกัน
example:
The school's student body lacks homogeneity.
There is a homogeneity in their musical tastes.
The study analyzed the homogeneity of the samples.

meaning_en: The policy of including people who might otherwise be excluded or marginalized.
meaning_th: การไม่แบ่งแยก
example:
The school promotes inclusivity in all its programs.
The goal is to create a sense of inclusivity for all students.
The company is committed to workplace inclusivity.

meaning_en: To teach (a person or group) to accept a set of beliefs uncritically.
meaning_th: ปลูกฝังความเชื่อ
example:
The purpose of education is not to indoctrinate students.
He was accused of trying to indoctrinate his followers.
The class was designed to indoctrinate students with a new philosophy.

meaning_en: Inborn; natural.
meaning_th: ที่มีมาแต่กำเนิด, โดยธรรมชาติ
example:
She has an innate talent for music.
Some scientists believe that language ability is innate.
He has an innate sense of humor.

meaning_en: Having or showing an interest in learning things; curious.
meaning_th: อยากรู้อยากเห็น
example:
She is a very inquisitive student.
The child has an inquisitive mind.
He asked many inquisitive questions about the topic.

meaning_en: Relating to relationships or communication between people.
meaning_th: ระหว่างบุคคล
example:
The program focuses on developing students' interpersonal skills.
He has excellent interpersonal skills.
Her interpersonal relationships at work are very positive.

meaning_en: The ability to read and write.
meaning_th: การรู้หนังสือ
example:
The program aims to improve adult literacy in rural areas.
Digital literacy is a vital skill in the modern world.
The government has launched a campaign to promote financial literacy.

meaning_en: To be enrolled at a college or university.
meaning_th: ลงทะเบียนเรียน
example:
She matriculated at Harvard University last year.
He hopes to matriculate next fall.
Students must complete a series of courses to matriculate.

meaning_en: A person who is advised, trained, or guided by a mentor.
meaning_th: ลูกศิษย์, ผู้ได้รับการแนะนำ
example:
The mentor and his mentee worked on the project together.
She is a mentee in the new program.
The mentee learned a lot from her mentor's experience.

meaning_en: (of a person or society) speaking only one language.
meaning_th: ใช้ภาษาเดียว
example:
Most people in the country are monolingual.
He is a monolingual speaker of English.
The study compares monolingual and bilingual children.

meaning_en: Combining or involving several academic disciplines or professional specializations in an approach to a topic or problem.
meaning_th: หลากหลายสาขาวิชา
example:
The research is a multidisciplinary study of art and science.
The team took a multidisciplinary approach to the problem.
The conference focused on multidisciplinary topics.

meaning_en: Relating to or being a person who is excessively concerned with minor details and rules.
meaning_th: จู้จี้จุกจิก, พิถีพิถัน
example:
His teaching style is very pedantic and rigid.
She was criticized for her pedantic attention to detail.
The professor was pedantic about grammar.

meaning_en: Dealing with things sensibly and realistically in a way that is based on practical rather than theoretical considerations.
meaning_th: ในทางปฏิบัติ
example:
He takes a pragmatic approach to education.
The solution was a pragmatic one.
We need to be pragmatic about the situation.

meaning_en: (of a person or action) creating or controlling a situation by causing something to happen rather than just responding to it after it has happened.
meaning_th: เชิงรุก
example:
A proactive teacher anticipates students' needs.
He is very proactive in his work.
We need to take a proactive stance on the issue.

meaning_en: A high degree of competence or skill; expertise.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญ
example:
The course is designed to improve language proficiency.
She demonstrated great proficiency in her work.
The exam measures your proficiency in English.

meaning_en: Relating to, measuring, or measured by the quality of something rather than its quantity.
meaning_th: เชิงคุณภาพ
example:
The study used a qualitative approach to analyze student feedback.
We need to do a qualitative assessment of the program.
The research is based on qualitative data.

meaning_en: To express or measure the quantity of something.
meaning_th: ระบุจำนวน
example:
It's hard to quantify the benefits of a good education.
The research aims to quantify the results.
You need to quantify your findings with numbers.

meaning_en: To adjust or readjust (something) to its previous state or to a new standard.
meaning_th: ปรับใหม่
example:
The teacher had to recalibrate her teaching methods after the feedback.
We need to recalibrate our goals.
The company decided to recalibrate its strategy.

meaning_en: Giving or intended as a remedy or cure.
meaning_th: แก้ไข, บรรเทา
example:
The school offers remedial classes for students who are struggling.
He received remedial reading instruction.
The program provides remedial assistance in math.

meaning_en: The continued possession, use, or control of something.
meaning_th: การรักษาไว้
example:
The school has a high student retention rate.
Employee retention is a key goal for the company.
The brain's retention of information is fascinating.

meaning_en: The provision of temporary support to help a student learn a new skill.
meaning_th: การช่วยเหลือแบบชั่วคราว
example:
Teachers use scaffolding to help students with difficult tasks.
The tutor provided scaffolding by breaking down the problem into smaller steps.
This method involves providing support that is gradually removed.

meaning_en: Relating to or characteristic of Socrates or his philosophy.
meaning_th: แบบโสคราติส
example:
The teacher used a Socratic approach to teaching.
The debate was a Socratic exchange of ideas.
His method of questioning is Socratic.

meaning_en: Particular needs of a person with a physical or mental disability.
meaning_th: ความต้องการพิเศษ
example:
The school has a program for students with special needs.
He is a teacher for special needs children.
The building has a ramp for people with special needs.

meaning_en: Not active, growing, or developing.
meaning_th: ที่หยุดนิ่ง, ซบเซา
example:
The stagnant economy is affecting funding for education.
His career has been stagnant for years.
The stagnant water was a breeding ground for mosquitoes.

meaning_en: The ability to sustain prolonged physical or mental effort.
meaning_th: ความอดทน
example:
Studying for the exam requires a lot of mental stamina.
He has the stamina of a long-distance runner.
You need stamina to work long hours.

meaning_en: To arrange or classify in a layered or hierarchical manner.
meaning_th: จัดเรียงเป็นชั้น
example:
The research study stratified the population by age and income.
The system tends to stratify students based on test scores.
Societies are often stratified by social class.

meaning_en: Based on or influenced by personal feelings, tastes, or opinions.
meaning_th: อัตวิสัย
example:
The grading for the art project is often subjective.
His opinion on the matter is very subjective.
The report is too subjective and lacks objective data.

meaning_en: Relating to or constituting a summary; concluded by a final act.
meaning_th: ที่สรุปผล
example:
A final exam is a summative assessment of a student's knowledge.
The project report provided a summative overview of the research.
This is a summative review of the whole year's work.

meaning_en: At the same time.
meaning_th: พร้อมกัน
example:
The students and teacher worked synchronously on the project via video call.
The two systems updated synchronously.
They logged into the platform synchronously for the live lecture.

meaning_en: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
meaning_th: คำอธิบายรายวิชา
example:
The syllabus for this course is available online.
The professor handed out the course syllabus on the first day.
The syllabus outlines the topics, readings, and assignments.

meaning_en: The branch of science concerned with classification.
meaning_th: อนุกรมวิธาน, การจัดหมวดหมู่
example:
Bloom's Taxonomy is a widely used framework for educational objectives.
The project involves the taxonomy of plants.
He has created a new taxonomy for his data.

meaning_en: The practice of working from home, making use of the Internet, email, and the telephone.
meaning_th: การทำงานทางไกล
example:
Telecommuting has become a new way to work for many people.
The company is encouraging telecommuting to reduce office costs.
She enjoys the flexibility of telecommuting.

meaning_en: To be or go beyond the range or limits of (something).
meaning_th: ก้าวข้าม, เหนือกว่า
example:
Education can help you transcend your limitations.
His music transcends cultural boundaries.
The artist's work transcends traditional forms.

meaning_en: Protection of or authority over someone or something; guardianship.
meaning_th: การสอน, การดูแล, การปกครอง
example:
She progressed quickly under the tutelage of her piano teacher.
The young artist benefited from the tutelage of a renowned painter.
Students receive expert tutelage from experienced instructors.

meaning_en: Not based on or conforming to what is generally done or believed.
meaning_th: ที่ไม่เป็นแบบแผน
example:
He has an unconventional teaching style.
The building's design is very unconventional.
The company uses an unconventional marketing strategy.

meaning_en: To support, justify, or form the basis for.
meaning_th: ค้ำจุน, สนับสนุน
example:
The new theory is underpinned by extensive research.
The principles of freedom underpin the country's laws.
His arguments are underpinned by strong evidence.

meaning_en: To express (ideas or feelings) in words.
meaning_th: พูดออกมา, แสดงความคิดเห็น
example:
Students were encouraged to verbalize their thoughts.
He found it difficult to verbalize his feelings.
She verbalized her concerns during the meeting.

meaning_en: A strong feeling of suitability for a particular career or occupation.
meaning_th: อาชีพ, งานที่ทำ
example:
She found her true vocation in teaching.
He feels that his vocation is to help others.
His passion for art turned into his vocation.

meaning_en: Based on or relating to a website or the Internet.
meaning_th: ที่ใช้เว็บเป็นฐาน
example:
The school uses a web-based learning platform.
The software is a web-based application.
We can access the materials through the web-based system.

meaning_en: A person who is a member of an academy or learned society.
meaning_th: นักวิชาการ
example:
He is a respected academician in his field.
The group of academicians met to discuss the new theory.
The university is a home for many famous academicians.

meaning_en: The evaluation or estimation of the nature, quality, or ability of someone or something.
meaning_th: การประเมินผล
example:
The teacher uses a variety of assessment methods to evaluate student progress.
The final assessment will be a written exam.
Regular assessments help identify areas for improvement.

meaning_en: Combining two or more things.
meaning_th: ผสมผสาน
example:
The university offers a blended learning program.
The new approach is a blended model of traditional and modern methods.
The recipe calls for a blended mix of herbs.

meaning_en: The subjects comprising a course of study in a school or college.
meaning_th: หลักสูตร
example:
The new curriculum places a greater emphasis on science.
The school is revising its curriculum to include more practical skills.
Students are required to take a broad range of subjects in their curriculum.

meaning_en: Recognized as or made different.
meaning_th: ที่แตกต่าง
example:
The teacher used a differentiated approach to teaching.
The company offers a differentiated product.
The students are grouped into differentiated levels.

meaning_en: The action of improving or enhancing the quality or value of something.
meaning_th: การเสริมสร้าง
example:
The school offers enrichment programs for gifted students.
Reading can provide a great intellectual enrichment.
The field trip was a great form of enrichment for the class.

meaning_en: Relating to the theory of knowledge.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับญาณวิทยา
example:
The debate took on an epistemological dimension.
His work has an epistemological focus.
She is interested in epistemological questions.

meaning_en: Characterized by the belief that the parts of something are interconnected and can be explained only by reference to the whole.
meaning_th: แบบองค์รวม
example:
A holistic approach to education focuses on the student's entire development, not just academic achievement.
We need to take a more holistic view of the problem.
The program promotes a holistic view of wellness, including mind, body, and spirit.

meaning_en: The process of putting a decision or plan into effect.
meaning_th: การนำไปใช้, การนำไปปฏิบัติ
example:
The implementation of the new policy will take time.
The project's success depends on its effective implementation.
The team is responsible for the implementation of the new system.

meaning_en: To motivate or encourage someone to do something.
meaning_th: จูงใจ, กระตุ้น
example:
The school will incentivize good attendance with rewards.
The company is trying to incentivize employees to work harder.
What will incentivize people to use this new system?

meaning_en: Relating to more than one branch of knowledge.
meaning_th: สหวิทยาการ
example:
The course is an interdisciplinary study of art and history.
We need an interdisciplinary approach to solve this problem.
Her research is highly interdisciplinary.

meaning_en: Repeating a process in a way that improves on previous results.
meaning_th: ซ้ำไปซ้ำมาเพื่อปรับปรุง
example:
The project used an iterative design process.
Learning is an iterative process of trial and error.
We will be making iterative changes to the software.

meaning_en: A policy or attitude of letting things take their own course, without interfering.
meaning_th: ปล่อยให้เป็นไปตามยถากรรม
example:
The professor's laissez-faire teaching style allowed students great freedom.
The government has adopted a laissez-faire approach to the economy.
He has a laissez-faire attitude towards his children's education.

meaning_en: The ability to read and write.
meaning_th: การรู้หนังสือ
example:
The program aims to improve adult literacy in rural areas.
Digital literacy is a vital skill in the modern world.
The government has launched a campaign to promote financial literacy.

meaning_en: The detailed coordination of a complex operation involving many people, facilities, or supplies.
meaning_th: การจัดการ, การขนส่ง
example:
The logistics of organizing the school trip were complex.
He is in charge of the event logistics.
The team handled the logistics for the conference.

meaning_en: Relating to or based on metacognition.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับอภิปัญญา
example:
The course encourages metacognitive strategies for learning.
She has a strong metacognitive awareness of her own thought process.
Metacognitive skills are crucial for effective self-learning.

meaning_en: The use of only one language.
meaning_th: การใช้ภาษาเดียว
example:
The program aims to move beyond monolingualism.
Monolingualism is becoming less common in a globalized world.
The study looked at the effects of monolingualism on cognitive development.

meaning_en: The use of more than one language.
meaning_th: ความสามารถหลายภาษา
example:
The school promotes multilingualism and cultural understanding.
Her multilingualism is an asset in her job.
Multilingualism is common in many parts of the world.

meaning_en: The method and practice of teaching.
meaning_th: ศาสตร์การสอน, การสอน
example:
The workshop focused on modern pedagogy and teaching techniques.
Effective pedagogy is crucial for student engagement.
Teachers are always seeking to improve their pedagogy.

meaning_en: A high degree of competence or skill; expertise.
meaning_th: ความเชี่ยวชาญ
example:
The course is designed to improve language proficiency.
She demonstrated great proficiency in her work.
The exam measures your proficiency in English.

meaning_en: Required for a particular purpose or position.
meaning_th: ที่จำเป็น
example:
A university degree is a requisite for this job.
He has all the requisite skills for the position.
Patience is a requisite for being a good teacher.

meaning_en: The provision of temporary support to help a student learn a new skill.
meaning_th: การช่วยเหลือแบบชั่วคราว
example:
Teachers use scaffolding to help students with difficult tasks.
The tutor provided scaffolding by breaking down the problem into smaller steps.
This method involves providing support that is gradually removed.

meaning_en: Relating to or constituting a summary; concluded by a final act.
meaning_th: ที่สรุปผล
example:
A final exam is a summative assessment of a student's knowledge.
The project report provided a summative overview of the research.
This is a summative review of the whole year's work.

meaning_en: At the same time.
meaning_th: พร้อมกัน
example:
The students and teacher worked synchronously on the project via video call.
The two systems updated synchronously.
They logged into the platform synchronously for the live lecture.

meaning_en: An outline of the subjects in a course of study or teaching.
meaning_th: คำอธิบายรายวิชา
example:
The syllabus for this course is available online.
The professor handed out the course syllabus on the first day.
The syllabus outlines the topics, readings, and assignments.

meaning_en: The branch of science concerned with classification.
meaning_th: อนุกรมวิธาน, การจัดหมวดหมู่
example:
Bloom's Taxonomy is a widely used framework for educational objectives.
The project involves the taxonomy of plants.
He has created a new taxonomy for his data.

meaning_en: Protection of or authority over someone or something; guardianship.
meaning_th: การสอน, การดูแล, การปกครอง
example:
She progressed quickly under the tutelage of her piano teacher.
The young artist benefited from the tutelage of a renowned painter.
Students receive expert tutelage from experienced instructors.

meaning_en: A student at a college or university who has not yet received a degree.
meaning_th: นักศึกษาระดับปริญญาตรี
example:
She is an undergraduate student at Cambridge.
The university offers many undergraduate courses.
He is in his final year as an undergraduate.

meaning_en: Not based on or conforming to what is generally done or believed.
meaning_th: ที่ไม่เป็นแบบแผน
example:
He has an unconventional teaching style.
The building's design is very unconventional.
The company uses an unconventional marketing strategy.

meaning_en: Relating to an occupation or employment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับอาชีพ, ทางอาชีวะ
example:
Vocational training provides practical skills for a specific job.
He chose a vocational college over a traditional university.
The new school offers a variety of vocational courses.

meaning_en: Based on or relating to a website or the Internet.
meaning_th: ที่ใช้เว็บเป็นฐาน
example:
The school uses a web-based learning platform.
The software is a web-based application.
We can access the materials through the web-based system.

meaning_en: Relating to education, especially at a college or university level.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับวิชาการ,ทางการศึกษา
example:
The university has a strong academic reputation.
He decided to pursue an academic career.
Academic success is not the only measure of intelligence.

meaning_en: The subjects comprising a course of study in a school or college.
meaning_th: หลักสูตร
example:
The new curriculum places a greater emphasis on science.
The school is revising its curriculum to include more practical skills.
Students are required to take a broad range of subjects in their curriculum.

meaning_en: The method and practice of teaching.
meaning_th: ศาสตร์การสอน, การสอน
example:
The workshop focused on modern pedagogy and teaching techniques.
Effective pedagogy is crucial for student engagement.
Teachers are always seeking to improve their pedagogy.

meaning_en: The ability to read and write.
meaning_th: การรู้หนังสือ
example:
The program aims to improve adult literacy in rural areas.
Digital literacy is a vital skill in the modern world.
The government has launched a campaign to promote financial literacy.

meaning_en: Relating to an occupation or employment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับอาชีพ, ทางอาชีวะ
example:
Vocational training provides practical skills for a specific job.
He chose a vocational college over a traditional university.
The new school offers a variety of vocational courses.

meaning_en: To make something greater by adding to it.
meaning_th: เพิ่มพูน, ขยาย
example:
The teacher uses technology to augment classroom learning.
He took a part-time job to augment his income.
These exercises are designed to augment your vocabulary.

meaning_en: A great difference.
meaning_th: ความเหลื่อมล้ำ, ความแตกต่าง
example:
There is a clear disparity in educational opportunities between urban and rural areas.
The report highlights the wage disparity between men and women.
They are working to address the global health disparity.

meaning_en: Characterized by the belief that the parts of something are interconnected and can be explained only by reference to the whole.
meaning_th: แบบองค์รวม
example:
A holistic approach to education focuses on the student's entire development, not just academic achievement.
We need to take a more holistic view of the problem.
The program promotes a holistic view of wellness, including mind, body, and spirit.

meaning_en: A qualification, achievement, or aspect of a person's background.
meaning_th: ใบรับรอง, คุณสมบัติ
example:
A university degree is a valuable credential for many jobs.
The company is looking for candidates with strong professional credentials.
He has impeccable credentials for the position.

meaning_en: Learning a topic through repetition and memorization, without understanding.
meaning_th: การเรียนแบบท่องจำ
example:
Rote learning is not effective for developing critical thinking.
He had to use rote learning to memorize the historical dates.
Modern education systems are moving away from rote learning.

meaning_en: Activities that complement the formal curriculum.
meaning_th: กิจกรรมเสริมหลักสูตร
example:
Participating in co-curricular activities is essential for a well-rounded education.
The school offers various co-curricular programs like sports and music.
Employers often look for candidates with strong co-curricular involvement.

meaning_en: Protection of or authority over someone or something; guardianship.
meaning_th: การสอน, การดูแล, การปกครอง
example:
She progressed quickly under the tutelage of her piano teacher.
The young artist benefited from the tutelage of a renowned painter.
Students receive expert tutelage from experienced instructors.

meaning_en: Required by law or a rule; obligatory.
meaning_th: ภาคบังคับ, ที่ต้องทำ
example:
Education is compulsory for children between the ages of 5 and 16.
It is compulsory to wear a seatbelt in the car.
Many countries have compulsory military service.

meaning_en: Relating to the mental processes of perception, memory, and judgment.
meaning_th: เกี่ยวกับความรู้ความเข้าใจ
example:
The test measures cognitive skills such as problem-solving.
Reading books can improve your cognitive function.
Children's cognitive development is a key focus of early education.

meaning_en: Inborn; natural.
meaning_th: ที่มีมาแต่กำเนิด, โดยธรรมชาติ
example:
She has an innate talent for music.
Some scientists believe that language ability is innate.
He has an innate sense of humor.

meaning_en: A thing that motivates or encourages one to do something.
meaning_th: สิ่งจูงใจ, แรงกระตุ้น
example:
The scholarship serves as an incentive for students to study hard.
The company offers a financial incentive for employees to improve their performance.
What is your incentive for taking this course?

meaning_en: To spread or disperse (information, ideas, etc.) widely.
meaning_th: เผยแพร่, กระจาย
example:
The school wants to disseminate information about the new program.
It is the media's role to disseminate news to the public.
We need to disseminate these findings to a wider audience.

meaning_en: To support (an organization or activity) financially.
meaning_th: อุดหนุน, สนับสนุนทางการเงิน
example:
The government subsidizes public universities to keep tuition fees low.
The state heavily subsidizes the public transport system.
The company will subsidize the cost of training for its staff.

meaning_en: Fair and impartial.
meaning_th: ที่เป็นธรรม, เสมอภาค
example:
The goal is to create a more equitable education system.
They are working to ensure an equitable distribution of resources.
Everyone deserves equitable access to healthcare.

meaning_en: Extremely useful; indispensable.
meaning_th: มีค่ามาก, ประเมินค่าไม่ได้
example:
His guidance was an invaluable asset to my project.
The teachers' support has been an invaluable resource.
These research findings are invaluable for the medical community.
